sentences.sentence: As Europe looks to promote public transport and reduce car usage, in Austria, the Klimatiket designed for that purpose has had mixed results.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Despite the lack of diplomatic ties between Washington and Tehran, U.S. President Joe Biden and Iran's Mohammed Raisi managed to finalize a controversial deal that saw five American prisoners fly out of Tehran on Monday in exchange for five Iranians held by the U.S.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Washington also agreed to unfreeze nearly $6 billion in Iranian assets to be held in Qatar and used only for humanitarian goods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Among those released by Iran was Mourad Tabaz, a British-American conservationist of Iranian descent who was arrested in 2018 and whose family had campaigned for his release.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The prisoners released by the U.S. were mostly held on charges of trying to export banned material to Iran, including dual-use electronics that could be used by the military.

sentences.sentence: Ukraine claims the victories will help them dislodge Russian forces from Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: An opponent says they are hollow victories. Время победы. Russia has released pictures of its own artillery units somewhere in Ukraine, but hasn't commented directly on Ukraine's declared seizure of the two villages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As summer turns to autumn, it remains unclear if a pivotal turning point in the fighting can be expected before winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia is calling on the International Court of Justice at The Hague to throw out a genocide case brought by Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Its representatives have begun making submissions to the judges, arguing the case has no legal basis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kyiv launched the action, saying Moscow's invasion was based on false allegations of genocide by Ukraine in eastern regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In its opening address, Russia's lawyer repeated the Kremlin's claims about what he called neo-Nazis in Kyiv and compared the invasion of Ukraine with NATO's airstrike on Serbia in 1999.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, Ukraine says it's Russia that's guilty of genocide and that its attempt to justify the invasion turns the UN's genocide convention on its head. It could be months before the court decides whether the case can proceed. If it does go ahead, a final ruling on the genocide charges is likely years away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After Bulgarian lawmakers decided to lift the ban on Ukrainian grain imports, farmers across the country have come out for a nationwide protest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At exactly 10 o'clock on Sunday, grain farmers and 20 organizations from the agricultural sector used heavy machinery to blockade 50 locations across the country, including the main Burgess-Varna road.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Fruit and vegetable growers and beekeepers also joined the rally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Protesters also blocked roads in central Bulgaria, despite police checks on their vehicles. The main highway across the Danube at the border crossing with Romania was also blocked by heavy equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: across the Danube at the border crossing with Romania was also blocked by heavy equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Farmers here say they were offended by the country's prime minister describing them as terrorists. The protests at the moment seem to be with demands that their problem is solved or with demands that cannot be solved in the way they want because they are putting up with deadlines In addition to stopping imports from Ukraine, farmers are also demanding additional funding from the state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Protesters from across the country are expected to gather at a large national rally in Sofia on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Austria's government wants to convince more of its citizens to adopt public transport, as vehicle emissions remain persistently high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So the Alpine Republic is pushing its new Klima-Ticket or Climate Ticket, an annual pass for all public transport from city buses to high-speed trains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It costs around 3 euros per day, clearly a winner in terms of price, but is it Es kostet ca. 3 Euro pro Tag.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Das ist klar ein Gewinn in Bezug auf den Preis, aber ist es genug, um Menschen zu enttäuschen?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Wir wohnen in Niederösterreich, spenden es in die Arbeit, natürlich nur mit dem Zug, aber benutzen es dann in Wien auch für andere Verkehrsmittel wie Bus und Straßenbahn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Seit rund zwei Jahren gibt es in Österreich das Klimaticket.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Doch nach einem anfänglichen Boom scheint die Nachfrage nachzulassen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Nur knapp drei Prozent der Bevölkerung besitzen diese flächendeckende Fahrkarte.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Christine hat sich nicht mehr mit dem Klimaticket verabschiedet, weil sie nur mit dem Auto arbeiten kann.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Wenn sie auf den Trainingsweg muss, dann wird sie sich individuell mit dem Klimaticket verabschieden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Ich kann mir nicht vorstellen, dass wir als Familie mal aufs Auto verzichten werden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Ich glaube, gerade im ländlichen Bereich wird man noch länger ein Auto brauchen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Auch wenn die Austriens die am häufigsten Reisende der EU sind, sind einige Teilnehmer der Familie noch nicht so gut verbunden, besonders in den Bergen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Aber laut einem Mobilitäts-NGO ist das Klima-Ticket immer noch ein großer Erfolg.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: For some months, a similar climate ticket has already been available in Germany, and now it's up to people to use them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I had to learn how to help people in completely different states of despair.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: In the heart of St. Petersburg, Sof, a volunteer at Center T, is currently inundated with a stream of desperate pleas for aid. The emails are from individuals in Russia's trans community grappling with uncertainty and fear as the parliament implements a controversial bill outlawing gender-affirming care. We answer every day, every week, without holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Center T, one of Russia's leading organizations supporting the transgender community, helps people get medical assistance, hormone access and even safe routes out of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In July, Moscow passed a law that bans gender-affirming care, invalidates marriages involving transgender individuals В июле Москва приняла закон, который отбирает обращение к женщинам с гендерным оборудованием, не обеспечивает взаимоотношения между гендерными индивидуальными и не обеспечивает гендерных людей от воспитания или обучения детей.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: В прошлом году этот закон следует за правилами, которые предоставляют любую позитивную или нейтральную представительность культуры ЛГБТК+, в общественных сферах, популярной культуре или даже в кино. culture in public spaces, popular culture, or even cinema.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: According to Maria Arkhipova, a Russian trans activist and human rights lawyer currently based in Georgia, these laws can have a deadly impact on the country's LGBTQ plus community. Кто-то будет вынужден бежать за границу.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Вместе с тем, активисты, как Софа и Алексей, выбирают остаться в стране, как только могут.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Если ставят вопрос именно между тюрьмой и отъездом, конечно, уже тут выбираешь отъезд.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Но я стараюсь максимально долго оставаться, потому что я вижу, что многие люди не могут уехать.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
